items.detailsPageTitle: Matlab TAH Model – Total Academic Headcount License (TAH)

sections.title: Overview
sections.content:
TAH MODEL: Allows campus-wide access on university-owned computers to all faculty, staff and students.

TAH Campus licenses support two activation types:

sections.title: Which Activation Type Should I Use?
headers: Is the computer connected to the IISc network?
sections.note: Faculty and staff are also entitled to install MathWorks software on their personally owned computers for their own use.

sections.title: Installation Instructions
sections.intro: 1. Users must fill the online form:
steps: Fill joining date + MAC address → Click **“Submit”**
Admin enrolls user in MathWorks account
Admin adds MAC address + Operating System to the license server
User receives email from MathWorks → temporary password
Reset password → login to MathWorks → accept terms
sections.note: Users are requested to send the PDF file to sysadmin.serc@iisc.ac.in for further processing.

items.name: Mathematica
items.description: A system for technical computing, used for numerical applications, symbolic manipulation, and data visualization.

sections.title: About Mathematica
sections.content: Mathematica is a modern technical computing system spanning most areas of technical computing — including neural networks, machine learning, image processing, geometry, data science, visualizations, and others. The system is used in many scientific, engineering, mathematical, and computing fields.
